page.title: 02THE EAST COKER LANDSCAPE
page.content:
The{landscape}is a varied one.In the south there is a{flat topped ridge}at about{350ft.}running from northwest to southeast from which the land falls away fairly steeply on each side.The rest of the land is low,about 175ft. and the{slopes are gentle}or even flat in places.There are many small{streams running from west to east,many{springs as well as the reservoir.
The area is{well wooded}especially at Coker Court Park.There are many farms with{small fields}which are separated by hedges many with trees among them.
There are several small{settlements but East Coker and North Coker are the main ones.
